<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### accumulateConstantOffset() {#a5c00e7e76ef5e98c6ffec8d31f63970a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::GEPOperator::accumulateConstantOffset (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; Offset, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt; bool(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;)&gt; ExternalAnalysis=nullptr) const</>}>
Accumulate the constant address offset of this GEP if possible.

This routine accepts an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> into which it will try to accumulate the constant offset of this GEP.

If <code>ExternalAnalysis</code> is provided it will be used to calculate a offset when a operand of GEP is not constant. For example, for a value <code>ExternalAnalysis</code> might try to calculate a lower bound. If <code>ExternalAnalysis</code> is successful, it should return true.

If the <code>ExternalAnalysis</code> returns false or the value returned by <code>ExternalAnalysis</code> results in a overflow/underflow, this routine returns false and the value of the offset <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> is undefined (it is <em>not</em> preserved!).

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> passed into this routine must be at exactly as wide as the IntPtr type for the address space of the base GEP pointer.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/operator-h/#l00543">543</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/operator-h">Operator.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/operator-cpp/#l00113">113</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/operator-cpp">Operator.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### collectOffset() {#a19b02b875049489fedf9c500d2424fa3}

Collect the offset of this GEP as a map of Values to their associated <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> multipliers, as well as a total <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> Offset.

### hasAllConstantIndices() {#aa4d79f790f6bd3fa3234d4137979215b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::GEPOperator::hasAllConstantIndices () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if all of the indices of this GEP are constant integers.

If so, the result pointer and the first operand have a constant offset between them.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/operator-h/#l00509">509</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/operator-h">Operator.h</a>.

### hasAllZeroIndices() {#a608bf9c26922fc798bc8bd85601ce94d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::GEPOperator::hasAllZeroIndices () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if all of the indices of this GEP are zeros.

If so, the result pointer and the first operand have the same value, just potentially different types.
